subject: Music
title: Noise and Mental Health
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Noise and Mental Health.

hook.text: Unwanted music is noise â€” and chronic noise exposure damages mental health as much as pollution.

buildup.text: Hospitals, open offices, and public spaces expose people to constant unwanted sound.

discovery.text: Studies link chronic noise to increased cortisol, sleep disruption, and cardiovascular disease.

twist.text: Music you don't choose is stressful â€” even pleasant music becomes aversive when you can't escape it.

climax.text: The right to silence may be the most undervalued mental health resource we have.

punchline.text: Music heals when you choose it. It harms when you can't escape it.
